title: Appears to fade Melasma
body: I had read an article that Grape Seed Extract may help fade melasma.  I've had melasma on my face, brown patches on my forehead and cheeks, for over 15 years. I never leave the house without make-up/foundation.  I've tried various hydroquinone fade creams, Retin A and other products attempting to get rid of the brown patches on my face (I have fair to medium skin).  I use high SPF sunscreen religiously every day, winter and summer, but the brown patches still appear, and are always darker in the summer.  I purchased this Grape Seed Extract at the beginning of the summer in hopes that it might help.  I've been taking two capsules per day, for the past 5 months or so.  At first I noticed that the brown patches didn't darken as they normally would during the summer. Eventually the melasma patches became paler, now the patches are the palest they have ever been in 15 years, much closer to my skin color.  I can use much less make-up/foundation to even out the look of my skin.  The only difference in my usual skin care routine has been taking two of these Grape Seed Extract capules every day for the past 5 months, I've gone through several bottles.  I am quite convinced that my significantly improved skin tone is likely a result of taking the Grape Seen Extract.  I've never written an Amazon review before, but I felt compelled to share my experience with fellow melasma sufferers.

title: Potent product
body: I am usually a skeptic when it comes to supplements. Many (most?) are advertised as having great benefits, based on little more than opinion. Anti-oxidants are somewhat different as they have more of a basis in evidence-based medicine. In my case, I find that grape seed extract provides a couple of concrete benefits.

title: I also use it daily to reduce anxiety and help my brain work better. I notice a difference
body: We use this grape seed extract for my son who has ADHD.

title: Does it lower eye pressure?
body: I don't normally like to take pills but my interocular pressure has been steadily moving up.  A year ago it was up to 22 to 24 mmHg  in both eyes.  A friend with glaucoma told me he thinks grape seed extract has helped  him.  I started  taking it about 100 days ago  and when I saw my doctor a few weeks ago  my pressure was down to 16 in both eyes. This is right in the middle of the normal range.  Did the grape seed extract cause this change?  Who knows?  But I plan to continue taking it.  I haven't noticed any ill effects.

title: A Miracle!
body: Over the summer I experienced a bout of acute pancreatitis.  I was in the hospital for far to long, and when I was released I was told eat low fat, and here's some morphine.  Well, I was well for a day or two, then the pain started again.  The doctors said to fast and start over, and here's some more morphine.  Well that kept up for about 6 weeks.  So I started searching the internet.  I found several sites that recommended grape seed extract, and a longer fast.  So I fasted for 4 days, started taking the grape seed extract, and then started eating slowly again.  Since then (over a month now) I have experienced no pain, do not take morphine, and am ecstatic!  I take one of the pills in the morning.  If I have a meal that might be questionable, I take another, but usually one a day.

title: A supplement with a great track record
body: I am usually a skeptic when it comes to supplements. Many (most?) are advertised as having great benefits, based on little more than opinion. Anti-oxidants are somewhat different as they have more of a basis in evidence-based medicine. In my case, I find that grape seed extract provides a couple of concrete benefits.

I quickly noticed improvement to wrinkles and cellulite. No complaints here.

title: This stuff is amazin ! Drastic reduction in allergies and arthritis in my knees
body: I started taking this product just because I had heard about the science behind it and some phenomenal benefits to general health – balancing out blood sugar, protecting the cardiovascular system, possible cancer prevention etc. I was not really expecting to notice anything, nevertheless the almost immediate benefits that I got. After I started taking this product within a week or so I noticed my knees were feeling better then they literally had in 5 years and I had a drastic reduction in my allergies. My allergies as a whole aren't that bad, especially because I take another supplement by Standard Process "Attronex" that prevents me from experiencing mild seasonal allergies… Which in Florida is most of the year. I highly recommend that product and a bottle will last you six months to a year depending on how you take it. After moving into another house last year I started having substantial allergies every morning. Anyways, at first I wasn't sure if The results were just a coincidence but after a few weeks when not only did that issues I was used to experiencing not come back but they continue to get better and better I was pretty sure it was this product. Months later I went on vacation and did not have this with me and within less than a week my knees felt absolutely horrible and I was experiencing substantial allergy symptoms too, thanks to my girlfriends cat. I was able to find a less potent version of the same supplement, also from the same Now brand while on vacation and paid way to much for it… But it was totally worth it! I also picked up some ginger, and this dried powdered form from the spice rack at the local grocery store, since this was another supplement I took for my knees but didn't have with me. Within less than two days of taking triple doses of the weak seed extract a couple times a day along with a tablespoon of ginger powder mixed in with some water (no it doesn't taste good thought I have done this every day for a couple years with either this or Tumerick) and I spent all day sightseeing the cliffs on the California ocean jumping from rock to rock and sightseeing in the mountains. Just two days earlier even going to the grocery store was killing my knees! were literally talking about around a 95% reduction in pain within a few days, while at the same time increasing a lot of activities that would definitely have  increased pain if I hadn't used these two supplements. Most hard-core narcotic medications can't even compete with that, plus the supplements arguing a bunch of good things for the mind and body, instead of having side effects and negatively affecting a persons health. Ginger is A really good supplement for joint pain, and a ton of other things, but I only get a 50 to 70% reduction in joint pain and it normally takes 5 to 7 days for the maximum effect.  I highly recommend this product just for general health benefits, but if you have any issues with joint pain, arthritis or respiratory allergies then you definitely want to try this. I'm sure works for a lot of other things as well. It definitely reduces inflammation in the body, which is why it works so well for me and those two issues, so supplement should reduce or possibly a lemonade hundreds of different Health issues.  Give it a try and if you notice it helping any other problems get better, please note it on here so other people can benefit from your experience.

title: Some Surprising Benefits!
body: I purchased this product back in the fall of 2014 because I read in a book on natural medicine, that Grape Seed Extract was actually good for treating ADD.  Having been diagnosed as an adult in my 40's and on prescription medication for this -that was having some unpleasant side-effects- I weaned off the prescription and decided to try this product.  Because natural medicine takes longer, I knew to NOT expect overnight results.  In regards to the ADD, I noticed fairly quickly, that it worked about 70% as well as the prescription medicine -at a fraction of the cost- and that was good enough for me to continue.  However, after several months of taking it, I noticed that I was not catching any of the usual, winter, upper-respiratory infections.  What's significant about that, is that every winter, at least three times, I'll come down with something and need antibiotics, and even asthma medication and this is the first winter I have not had to deal with any of it.  I've come down with a couple of very mild colds that lasted only 3 days.  No bronchitis, no sinus infections, nothing else.  Because I've made no other changes, it can only be the Grape Seed Extract so it's a definite keeper for me.  No side effects that I'm aware of except not getting sick when everyone else is, and that's pretty great. Highly recommend!

title: Unexpected results
body: I have just started my second bottle of this product and I Love It! I read that it was supposed to be good for hair regrowth so, I decided to try it. I am taking it along with a hyaluronic acid pill each day. I have not noticed any real change in my hair but here is the biggest change that I did not expect at all. I have suffered from severe swelling in my ankles and feet for several months. Everything I tried could not get the fluid off. I got a clean bill of health from my dr and he could not figure it out either. I started taking both of these pills together and within a week I was noticing a change in my feet and ankles. Another two weeks and they were completely normal! I have been taking this product for over two months now and my ankles and feet have not swollen since. I cannot tell you if it is the grape seed or the hyaluronic acid or the combination of the two. All I know, is that it is working for me! I recommend that you ask your dr about it. I also checked with my pharmacist and he told me that neither one of these pills would interfere with any medication I was taking. So, in my opinion, it's definitely worth a try.

title: Cholesterol result lower than its ever been.

I had my physical after my first full bottle and for the first time my cholesterol was UNDER 200 and my good cholesterol was off the charts and the bad was lower than ever before. I immediately bought three more. My husband cannot take statins so now I have him started and we will both continue with this brand and dosage

I can't say for sure, but I do think that this is the reason for my much improved eye sight.  I had what are called "floaters" and they were getting worse and worse with time.  So bad in fact that I was concerned about my upcoming driver's license renewal.  Additionally, I have a good friend who's eyes were messed up badly by the treatment to fix this problem, and after reading up on it I decided I did not want to take that chance.  Anyway, they are gone now!  And the only thing I have done different in my life is take this supplement.  One last point, the company has been very cordial and friendly sending a note with each new bottle I buy.  It is probably a form letter, but still it is nice that they take that much time to say thanks.

This is a good product and works for what I use it for which is to eliminate the inflammation, pain and nausea due to pancreatitis. The readers of my blog tell me I should write a book because I have figured out how to heal, stay well and live a fairly normal life - pain free. If you want to learn to do the same visit [...]  because my info is free and won't cost $30 like others charge.

title: Doctor Recommended

The protocol is working, and after years of failing health, I feel like I am living again. I have been on this product for over eight months now (Apr 2011) and have not even had a cold or flu since, and my Lupus flares are much shorter in duration. I don't know how much this product contributes to my overall health, but I am so thankful to feel healthier, that its part, no matter how small, is worth the five stars.

Also the recommended dosage is 1\16th of a tsp. A tiny bit goes a very long way, but I do suggest getting the proper tools to make your own caps. I bought the tiny teaspoons and I'm looking into a cap filler.. otherwise you can just sprinkle the powder on cereal or in a drink.. it's just bitter to taste  Hooray for GSE!! If you google GSE and stomach flu.. there are many articles on how it can kill the virus and prevent you from getting it! I'm true testimony to that.. as my family had two bouts of the nasty bug and this along with grape juice (which if you google that, also, may prevent the bug) I've avoided getting it both times! Plus there are many more benefits to GSE!

ONLY PROBLEM is capping it, which I have to do, as I could not find a way to get past the taste (it would be okay in smoothies I guess, but take mostly on empty stomach). Now, I'll put some pretty bad tasting stuff in a shot glass, throw it back, and chase it with more water and an ounce of juice. Can't do that with this...it tastes BAD and stays in your mouth. I'm wondering if anyone has found a way to consume it on a mostly empty stomach without capping it. (capping takes me about 10 minutes for 24 500 mg. caps. - if I weren't retired I'd probably still be buying it in caps). Still FIVE STARS ... great product.

Small containers with a screw-on cap work a little better for me, especially if you get these in the 10-25g or other small size containers. The 250-500g containers I have no issues with now as the powder is still close to the top. Aside from this, BulkSupplements is great and there are so many great supplements that you can get from them and not from other competitors. I have ordered Milk thistle, Coq10, R-ALA, ALCAR, L-Citruilline, L-Norvaline, Rhodiola Rosea, Creatine, L-Glutamine, L-Tyrosine, DMAE, LongJack, and BCAA from BulkSupplements and I am pleased with each. I had one almost pint size and have more left over in the packet when the jar is empty.  I cut down to where the powder was and carefully spooned it into the jar.  Now I can use a measure spoon and no powder escapes or travels.  Okay, that being said.  This is the real deal.  I always taste any powder I use, and this has a fruity and almost bitter flavor which works great with my morning smoothie.  I don't need anything to sweeten what I already use.  I use BulkSupplements for almost everything for powdered supplements and have never been disappointed.  Of course one can't tell until a long time later if a supplement seems to improve health, but of course I go with the studies and know I'm doing what I can for myself. It is a little tricky measuring - the smallest measuring spoon I have is 1/8 tsp.  But I have been trying 1/16 tsp, which is basically half of the measure that I have. title: Worth a try, but buy the smaller size.
body: I had never tried grape seed extract before, but have read about it's benefits as a supplement similar to the 'Fountain of Youth'. I mix the extract in smoothies, & so far so good. That is, as long as you use the recommended every other day dosing. Which is approximately 1/16 of a tsp (aka a 'pinch' will do, a dainty pinch). In hind site, I should have purchased the smaller sized bag. I can't imagine finishing this bag this year or next.

title: Switched to powder and won't buy pre-made capa again
body: I substituted this for the grape seed extract it was using from another company in pill form. The price is unbelievably better than buying capped. A capping machine is about $15 so I'm using that to make these. I see no difference in efficacy from the previous brand to this one. My cholesterol will be tested in May and I can update with specidic numbers then.

title: 5 star no complaints

The weather here is getting colder & people are getting sick especially those taking flu shots smh. To prevent that im doing what I can naturally. title: BulkSupplements is my preferred brand for supplement and this grapeseed extract seems to be of very good quality.
body: I purchase a lot of bulk supplements here on Amazon and BulkSupplements is my favorite brand. There prices are always among the best here on Amazon and all of their products I have tried including this grape extract powder to be of good quality and I have never found any foreign matter in the bag as I have with some of the other brands. The bags are also strong and easy to reseal unlike some of the other brands which I often must reseal with clips and have also arrived with tears and holes.

title: Love the Concept
body: But in order to take the amount that I'm supposed to take, I need to locate a 1/64 teaspoon. Instead, I just put a titch on the end of a toothpick or knife edge and hope I'm getting what I need. Otherwise, it's great. It has a super strong flavor that tastes a bit like really strong, bitter black tea that has been boiled down to a syrup. It's not awful, but it's not nice either. Still...it's a much cheaper way to take grape seed extract than capsules.
